When schools open again, allergic children must be guaranteed:
social distancing, washing hands frequently with warm running water with ordinary soap (to be rubbed on all areas of the hands for at least 30â€‰s) or with disinfectant gels without rinsing. To be noted that washing hands should not be excessive in children with atopic dermatitis.
for children with a food allergy, the exclusion of the food in question;
emergency therapy, self-injectable intramuscular adrenaline, and salbutamol spray, according to the individual therapeutic plan [ 82].
